thread.title: US eases crude oil export ban; allows trading with Mexico
thread.title_full: US eases crude oil export ban; allows trading with Mexico

title: US eases crude oil export ban; allows trading with Mexico
text:
Sat, Aug 15, 2015, 5:14 AM AEST - Australia Markets closed US eases crude oil export ban; allows trading with Mexico US to allows some crude oil trading with Mexico, further easing longstanding export ban By Josh Lederman, Associated Press | Associated Press – 42 minutes ago Recommend Print 
EDGARTOWN, Mass. (AP) -- The U.S. is easing its longstanding ban on crude oil exports by allowing limited trade with Mexico. 
That's according to a senior Obama administration official who wasn't authorized to comment by name and requested anonymity. 
Mexico's state-run oil company Petroleos Mexicanos, or Pemex, has sought to import about 100,000 barrels of light U.S. crude a day. Last year it proposed a deal in which the U.S. would trade the light crude for heavier Mexican crude. 
The official says the Commerce Department is approving some license applications for the exchange of similar amount of U.S. and Mexican crude. 
Congress has pressed the Obama administration to lift the crude oil ban, with Republicans arguing it would make the U.S. an energy superpower. The ban has been in place for four decades. @y7finance on Twitter, become a fan on Facebook NT upbeat over cattle exports to Thailand AAP
